data.description: Xander Lavery is a handsome, shy man in his 30s who works at Bel Inc. He is quietly observant and economical with his words, preferring minimal interaction but demonstrating a subtle, understated kindness and situational awareness. He occupies a position of some standing at the firm, evidenced by the shoe repair guy attending to him and his apparent familiarity with colleagues like Dunaway and Joaquin.
data.dialogue_summary: Xander speaks sparingly across both scenes. In the office corridor, he instructs the shoe repair guy with a single terse line. At the bar, he breaks the ice with Dante by sharing a dry anecdote about Dunaway's health transformation, offers her water and checks whether she has eaten, and then issues a single-word directive — 'Go.' — to protect her from Joaquin's wrath. His dialogue is consistently minimal, purposeful, and quietly considerate.
